title: "Skibladner" blackletter w/ looped ascenders
content:
Hey guys-

Wondering if anyone can identity this typeface or is it hand drawn?

Thanks for the help.

Cheers

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 3.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201164933/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%203_24.png) | 77.21 KB |

 [‹ (x) sans in agenda - News Gothic {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201164933/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34209 "Go to previous forum topic") [New Official Premier League Lettering+Numbering ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201164933/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34210 "Go to next forum topic")
author: J_P_C

comments.content:
Some of Manfred Klein’s Blackletter fonts for FontFont have loops on the ascenders, but that is an unusual feature. I think your sample looks hand-lettered, however. Manfred has generously made most of his fonts available for free at [TypOasis](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201164933/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/klein/index.htm), and he has helped with some of the [Blackletter revival](http://web.archive.org/) fonts on that site too, but I don’t think this is among them.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks Mike, will look into this...

best

Wa-hell, I am pretty sure I’ve seen it before, but can’t place it. But there is [Ayres Royal](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201164933/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/ayres-royal/) by Gert Wiescher … for a start.

Hey Rainer;

Thanks for the link... it’s very very close!  
Tried looking within the search for similar but no luck. Any idea of where else I could look? Or maybe the creater of this has modified the serif’s.

Thanks for your help- most appreciated.

Cheers  
Jason
